Government isn’t the answer to all of this. But just because govt policy can’t do everything doesn’t mean it can’t do anything. 

Govt policy should empower family & community.

And govt policy should make dignified work the central goal of our economic policy.

2/2

America isn’t an economy. Our wellbeing isn’t determined solely by the size or growth of our GDP. 

America is a nation. And our well being depends on strong families & communities which in turn depend on an economy that produces dignified work. 1/2

Touches on a larger point: w/ low pay, multiple jobs, a burning planet, war on drugs & few protections for the LGBT+, the political status quo has done so little for so many that when regular people win, we don’t feel as though we owe it much of anything at all.

RT @alexisohanian Me in 2005: "I'm going to start a startup."
Me in 2005 had there been a 70% marginal tax rate on incomes over $10 million: "I'm going to start a startup."

The thing Republicans taking cheap shots forget to mention is that it’s about having trouble affording a SECOND apartment.

I live in the Bronx and work in DC. Need a spot in both.

But I understand how they can’t conceive of a life where people don’t casually maintain 2 homes. https://twitter.com/jordanuhl/status/1084590067610517504 QT @JordanUhl It’s a great that @AOC could even maintain rent while campaigning & especially during the post-election/pre-swearing in period. Expecting her to easily drop serious cash in another high-rent area is ludicrous and only perpetuates the idea that the wealthy are worthy electeds.

Fun fact: @chrislhayes is from the Bronx too! https://twitter.com/chrislhayes/status/1084588181322907648 QT @chrislhayes @geneweingarten @AOC It’s a running joke (half tongue in cheek) from Desus and Mero about how strong *their* brand is. Sort of a Bronx pride thing.
... should someone tell him 😂 https://twitter.com/geneweingarten/status/1084587481884962818

When the brand is so strong random bypassers act as a Bronx group chat 🙅🏿‍♂️🙅🏽‍♀️ https://twitter.com/desusnice/status/1084575899968815104 QT @desusnice “OMG you’re that guy. I love @aoc, tell her that” - Random woman on 34th street

Is it weird that I love that this is posted by the NYT Metro account?

You can take the girl out of the BX, but you can’t take the BX out of the girl 🥰 https://twitter.com/nytmetro/status/1084548917633736704 QT @NYTMetro Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (@aoc) has had the uncanny ability for a first-term member of Congress to push the debate inside the Democratic Party sharply to the left. Here's why. https://trib.al/2LGCQ1A

“Seeds.”

Out of the minority of seats they have in Congress, the GOP allowed a white supremacist to represent ~700,000 people.

Republicans won’t even censure him.

They also protect a president who can’t bring himself to condemn neo-Nazis.

Those aren’t seeds.
They’re redwoods. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1083964094171045888 QT @washingtonpost Opinion: The GOP must stamp out the seeds of hatred before it’s too late https://trib.al/FfgeG9h

You’d say “that’s cool, but not the same thing as this very crucial electorate, maybe hire someone from the Midwest w/ intimate understanding” and they just throw their hands up and say “now you’re calling me racist?”

It’s like that ??? meme but reading the newspaper every day

Like, imagine if the world was flipped & CBS hired an all-poc team to cover 2020, & someone said “hey, white voters are really influential in presidential elections, especially in the Midwest. You should have some white journos who get that” & someone said “I found a Serbian guy”

Also I never called anyone racist, just inadequate. 

Also never called for strict quotas, just having representation of one of the most fundamental voting blocs in the American electorate. https://twitter.com/hotlinejosh/status/1084289808464334849?s=21 QT @HotlineJosh @anildash The “truth”=claiming companies are racist if they don’t impose strict racial quotas on all their hiring decisions.

I keep thinking about this exchange bc there are many aspects that are concerning to hear from an *editor.*

This is what false equivalence looks like: diminishing Trump‘s “enemy of the people” talk as “scolding” & describing my call to hire a black journalist as the same thing. https://twitter.com/hotlinejosh/status/1084284162654306306 QT @HotlineJosh Another thing AOC has in common with Trump: media scold. https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1084283573178433541

RT @kurtbardella If you don’t get @AOC’s success - just look at her response to @realDonaldTrump - #AOC wasn’t using a teleprompter. She spoke like she was talking about a conflict involving humans, many of them vulnerable, who have become pawns in a political standoff https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/alexandria-ocasio-cortez-s-response-trump-wall-speech-revealed-why-ncna957096

One of the most important things people can do to get big money out of politics is small recurring monthly donations. (You can see the monthly button on this link)

It’s like Netflix, but for unbought members of Congress.

It’s why I can act independently.
https://secure.actblue.com/donate/ocasio2018

I often find that some members who have to do call time the most are very enthusiastic about getting money out of politics.

Members do want less obligations to lobbyists & more leg. work, but some House races cost < $10 million; & that’s *every 2 years* before outside spending!

This week I learned some members spend as little as 5 hours per WEEK in their office bc their fundraising commitments are so high.

It’s not them, it’s our broken system of campaign finance.

Bc I rely on recurring small dollar donors (https://ocasio2018.com/donate !), I can do my job. https://twitter.com/saikatc/status/1083728597309931521 QT @saikatc I learned yesterday that attendance at committee meetings is abysmally low. Committee chairs are excited when we tell them '@AOC doesn't do call time, so we can actually show up!'. Just showing up is too high a bar for these legislators telling us we need to learn the ropes.
